p: Da Silva et al. [ 10] report part of a biogenetic map for limonoids featuring all structural types found in Meliaceae. Route 1.1.2 shows the B,D-seco class, which is characteristic of Swietenioideae, as previously mentioned. This route is related to the most commonly found limonoid class in the genus Cedrela. As shown in Table 11, other classes were found; one can affirm that they are associated with the B,D-ring class as biosynthetic intermediaries.
